transcripts.transcript_text:
Speaker A: Hello? Yeah, hi, this is Priyanka. Actually we are. I'm so sorry, can you hear me?
Speaker B: Yes, who am I speaking to?
Speaker A: Yes, this is Priyanka. Actually, we are official booking partners with the University College London. And I see that.
Speaker B: Oh yes, yes.
Speaker A: So actually, I see that you have filled out a form. Form. I see that you have filled out the form for three different properties. One is Axo, Oxford Circus. The second is Chapter, Kings Cross, and the third is Bloomsbury, Janet Bogey. So can you let me know if you are interested in booking any of these properties?
Speaker B: Okay, so you're telling me that the. So I booked in three different properties, Is that what you're saying?
Speaker A: Yes, you have filled the form like you have shown your interest. So, like I'll be the manager for your booking thing. So if you are interested in any of the properties, do let me know. I'll be helping you with the entire paperwork and everything.
Speaker B: Okay. So how should I contact your father? I think I received an email from you. Is that correct?
Speaker A: Yes, it was. I guess it was on September 5th. Like it was on Friday. Yes.
Speaker B: Yeah, I saw that.
Speaker A: So.
Speaker B: This is from Amber, right? Student accommodation.
Speaker A: Right.
Speaker B: So my current situation is that I booked them in case that I will need them because I applied for UCL's managed course.
Speaker A: But then they are not.
Speaker B: The UC accommodation is not replying to me. Like, they are not giving me any offer at the moment because my.
Speaker A: Yes.
Speaker B: So my course is supposed to start in like two weeks time.
Speaker A: So from the three, you're asking me.
Speaker B: If I am interested in any of them.
Speaker A: Right. Right. And you know, as this is the peak time, so we are not sure if you would be getting any on campus accommodation. So that's the reason. Because, you know, if you keep on waiting for those options, you might lose out on the ones that you have already shortlisted, that you have already liked. So.
Speaker B: Yes. So I'll contact you further from email, would that be okay?
Speaker A: Yes, that's completely fine. And also if you. If it is fine with you, can you help us with your WhatsApp number so you know, the communication becomes easier on WhatsApp.
Speaker B: I do not have a WhatsApp number because WhatsApp is banned in my country.
Speaker A: Okay. Okay. All right. Not a problem. You can just, you know, reach out to me on WhatsApp. Sorry, on email. I will just send you one more email. Okay. So you have my email address. You will have my contact number in that email. Everything will be present there. Okay. And you could also see my name.
Speaker B: It's Priyanka okay, so let me see if the email is here.
Speaker A: Sure.
Speaker B: Okay, I saw that now. Okay, I can see your contact numbers and yep. Your email address as well. So I'll contact you from this. I think it'll be in a few days time. This because I hope that I'll get a final decision from UCL accommodation. In case they say that I'm not available at all then I will have to definitely choose from the booking ones that I just did. So yeah, thank you very much for calling. So for UCL accommodation I'm hoping to get that at the moment because that is something that I put in for my visa application. All that as well. I would prefer to live in my campus on campus accommodation. I'm also international first year student so I hope that I get in there. If that's not the case. Thank you very much. I'll contact you from email.
Speaker A: Okay, not a problem. And also, you know, if it is fine with you, you can give me a follow up time so you know, if I don't hear back from you I can, you know, get in touch with you just to take a follow up. If it is fine, I will let you know. Okay, not a problem. If you have any questions also do let me know.
Speaker B: Okay, thank you very much.
Speaker A: No worries. Thank you so much for your time. Have a good day.
Speaker B: Thank you.
Speaker A: Bye bye.

Speaker A: Hello. Hello.
Speaker B: Hello.
Speaker A: Yes. Yes, this is Priyanka.
Speaker B: Yes, hello Priyanka.
Speaker A: Yes. Yes.
Speaker C: So you were asking about the installment plan, right?
Speaker A: Sorry? You were asking about the installment plan, correct?
Speaker B: Yes, I was talking about the installment plan. And also how much do we have to pay like that and when do we have to pay for each plan?
Speaker C: Okay, just give me one moment. Let me give you an idea on this.
Speaker A: Actually, what happens, the exact dates and the exact amount will be given to you in the contract itself.
Speaker B: Okay.
Speaker A: So the thing is before we book your accommodation we won't be able to figure out the exact amount. But there is this student like there is some other student who has booked the same property. And I can just check the installment dates and then I can tell you. Give me one minute.
Speaker B: I'm sorry, what do you mean there's.
Speaker A: Yes, so I was just saying that.
Speaker C: Before booking the accommodation, right? So before processing your application we cannot.
Speaker A: Confirm the exact dates and the exact.
Speaker C: Amounts that are taken.
Speaker A: Okay. So. But there is some other student who has booked another property from Chapter itself.
Speaker C: So I can just check their contract.
Speaker A: And let you know about the installment dates.
Speaker C: I cannot confirm the amount. Yes, I cannot confirm the amount. But it totally depends on the property.
Speaker A: Okay. What amount? What ratio? They divide the amount.
Speaker B: Yes. And also I would like to ask you about the term. So since I'll be starting, I'll be studying at ucl. Chapter actually has a UCL term. Right?
Speaker C: You see.
Speaker A: One second.
Speaker B: Yes, that's a ucl like lease term, I think.
Speaker A: Yes. Yeah.
Speaker B: Yes.
Speaker A: Yes, please go ahead. You were saying something?
Speaker B: Sorry to interrupt. Yeah. So that lease term, it's starts. It starts on 25th of September.
Speaker A: Yeah. Okay. And the accommodation date, it starts from the 6th of September, right?
Speaker C: No, sorry, the.
Speaker A: Like the accommodation date, their contract will start from the 6th of September. But you can move in anytime after this.
Speaker B: No, that is definitely a possible thing. But there is another lease term right from Chapter specifically for ucl.
Speaker A: Okay.
Speaker B: That's written in our student. Sorry, schools email. So I would like to confirm if that is possible.
Speaker A: I'm really not sure about that because you know we haven't received any such information from the accommodation team. So maybe you know, once you book.
Speaker C: The accommodation you can just write them.
Speaker A: An email and confirm this thing. Okay. Because when you become the. Once you become the tenant for that.
Speaker C: Property, they will accommodate that request.
Speaker B: Okay. I have done an inquiry too. From. From your site and also directly to chapter. I'm just. I'm just worried if I will not get the. The property. So. Yeah.
Speaker C: No, no, it's nothing like that.
Speaker A: You will definitely get the property. We can just, you know, go ahead and book the accommodation for you and you will see all of the details. Just to let you know. Three, like, the first installment date would be now, like right after you book the accommodation. Okay.
Speaker C: So you will have to pay the.
Speaker A: Booking deposit, which is, I guess, one second.
Speaker B: Okay.
Speaker C: So right now there is no deposit.
Speaker A: Because you are booking in the month of September itself. So you have to directly pay the first installment now.
Speaker C: Okay. And once after you move in, the.
Speaker A: Second installment will be due in the month of October.
Speaker C: So the first week of October and.
Speaker A: The third installment will be in the month of January, and the last installment will be in the month of April.
Speaker B: Okay, so October, January and April. Right, right.
Speaker C: And September now.
Speaker B: Okay, great. Of course.
Speaker A: Yeah. And your rent would become two times expensive, as I mentioned.
Speaker C: So the rent will become two times expensive. Last time we had a word about this, right? Canvas do give four installments if you.
Speaker A: Pay the, like the entire rent up.
Speaker C: Front before move in. So your rent will be two times cheaper if you are opting for two installments. So there is no discount, there is no additional charges. And if you pay in four installments, your amount will be 2% more expensive.
Speaker B: Okay, I got it. So the smaller the installments, the more.
